title: Meghalaya rebels pull out of peace talks
description: The proscribed Hynniewtrep National Liberation Council (HNLC) of Meghalaya has pulled out of peace talks with the Centre and the state government, citing a deadlock on "fundamental issues" after six months of dialogue. The outfit's chairman and commander-in-chief, Boby Marwein, and general secretary-cum-publicity secretary Sainkupar Nongtraw wrote to the Centre's interlocutor A K Mishra on December 31, saying they were "reluctantly withdrawing from the peace talks". The outfit recently issued a death threat to an MLA, Gavin Mylliemngap of the governing National People's Party over the cabinet decision to shut down Mawmluh-Cherra Cements Ltd.

title: Once in a lifetime event, says temple invitation docket
description: The coveted invitation docket for the Ram Mandir consecration ceremony on January 22 describes the event as "grand, and a rare one, coming after 495 years" and the invitation as "once in a lifetime opportunity, ".  To be handed over to the select VVIPs, the docket has a set of exquisitely decorated paper sheets, booklets, and an image of Lord Ram. According to the invite, 5 people - PM Modi, Mohan Bhagwat (RSS chief), Anandi Ben Patel (governor of UP), Yogi Adityanath (CM of UP), and Mahant Nritya Gopal Das - will be present in the "garbh grih" (sanctum sanctorum) when the sacred ceremony will be performed.

title: Only BJP-led government can fulfil women's aspirations: PM Modi
description: Addressing a huge gathering of women at Thrissur's Thekkinkadu Maidan on Wednesday, Prime Minister Narendra Modi spoke about his and his government's achievements in empowering women and insisted that even in Kerala only a BJP-led NDA govt could fulfil their aspirations going forward. In his 19-minute speech, the PM used the phrase "Modiyude guarantee (Modi's guarantee)" 18 times. Repeatedly prefacing his remarks in Malayalam with "ente ammamarum, sohidarimarum (my dear mothers and sisters)", Modi called on Kerala's women to participate in large numbers to prove their power.

title: To counter oppn, PM Modi leads BJP drive on Ram temple event
description: Taunted by opposition parties over Ram Mandir in Ayodhya, BJP has launched a massive campaign for the consecration ceremony scheduled for January 22 with PM Modi leading from the front and other saffron organisations complementing his efforts. Reference of the temple construction and the consecration ceremony has been invariably used by the PM in his public speeches and has also highlighted how people are excited about the "historic" occasion. The PM, while unveiling various projects in Ayodhya, had exhorted Ram devotees to celebrate Diwali on January 22 and light lamps in their homes.

title: SC vows to end caste bias in jail, sends notices to govts
description: The Supreme Court on Wednesday vowed to eradicate caste-based discrimination of inmates inside jails and issued notices to 13 states and the Union government after entertaining a PIL which alleged that inmates belonging to Dalit communities and denotified tribes, often referred to as habitual offenders, were assigned menial jobs and labour-intensive work inside jails. Senior advocate S Muralidhar drew the attention of a bench led by CJI D Y Chandrachud to a December 2020 news article by petitioner journalist Sukanya Santha on the discriminatory treatment meted out to prisoners in jails across the country.

title: Can't summon bureaucrats at drop of a hat: SC to HCs
description: The Supreme Court on Wednesday framed a procedure to restrain courts from summoning bureaucrats at the drop of a hat and set aside illogical orders of Allahabad high court such as taking into custody UP's finance secretary in contempt proceedings and issuing bailable warrants against the chief secretary for not implementing its orders to provide domestic helps to retired chief justices and judges. The UP government moved the SC challenging the HC's orders to examine the contentious issue keeping in mind the separation of powers between the executive and the judiciary.

title: J'khand coalition MLAs stand by Hemant Soren amid clash with ED
description: The coalition has total 48 MLAs from JMM, Congress and RJD in the 81-member assembly. Five MLAs did not turn up for the meeting. The meeting at Soren's residence came amid speculations that the CM, who is facing ED summons in a land scam case, might step down and install his wife Kalpana as his replacement from the Gandey assembly constituency, whose MLA Sarfaraz Ahmad resigned abruptly on December 31. Lawmakers who attended the meeting said no discussions over a change of face in the leadership were held.

title: Often, you wait for coronation and get exiled: Shivraj
description: Shivraj, who was CM for over 16 years, was replaced by Mohan Yadav after BJP won a landslide victory in the assembly polls, winning 163 of the 230 seats. As of now, BJP leadership is silent on his political future. "There must be some reason. Many times, you wait for coronation and get exiled," Chouhan said at a meeting in Shahgunj in Budhni. "This happens for the fulfilment of a purpose.I have come into this world to rid you of sorrow and pain. I will work day and night," the former CM said.

title: MP CM removes collector over 'aukaat' jibe at truck driver
description: The collector of Madhya Pradesh's Shajapur district, Kishore Kumar Kanyal, was removed from his post by CM Mohan Yadav on Wednesday, following his "aukaat kya hai" snub at a truck driver during a meeting to resolve the truckers' protest. The CM warned that such language would not be tolerated and that he would "never forgive" such acts. "Officials, no matter how big, should always respect the poor and their feelings. Such language will not be tolerated, not in our government," Yadav said. Kanyal, replaced with 2014-batch IAS officer Riju Bafna, was sent to the state secretariat as a deputy secretary.

title: Don't make Gyanvapi report public for 4 more weeks: ASI
Asha, cheetah named by PM, gives birth to triplets at Kuno
description: These Indian-born cheetahs were spotted for the first time on December 26, say sources. It's the second litter since the African cheetahs were translocated to Kuno in September 2022. Four cheetahs were born to Siyaya aka Jwala and 'rockstar' Freddie on March 24, 2023. They were the first cheetah cubs to be born in the wild in the country since cheetahs went extinct over seven decades ago. Unfortunately, three of them died in the heat of the Indian summer but one survived.

title: Survey for metro project connecting in Dehradun to start soon
description: In the first phase, IG Drones, a drone technology and analytics company, has been awarded the contract to conduct a topographical survey to prepare a detailed project report (DPR) for the proposed Personalised Rapid Transit corridor (PRT) within Dehradun city. The PRT corridor is proposed to be established from Panditwari to Railway station, Clement Town to Balliwala and Gandhi Park to IT Park. The proposal for the metro rail in Dehradun was approved by the state cabinet in February 2022 and has since been awaiting consideration at the Union government level.

title: Passenger bookings on rlys still 18% below pre-Covid levels
Portable desi missile shield trial to begin soon
description: The very short-range air defence system (VSHORADS), developed by DRDO to neutralise low-altitude aerial threats at ranges up to 6-km, "should be offered for user trials to the armed forces by April-May", a senior defence official told TOI. "The indigenously-developed 4th generation VSHORADS is technically superior to existing MANPADS (man-portable air defence systems) in the Indian armed forces because it has a state-of-the-art uncooled imaging infrared seeker," he said. VSHORADS offer a low-cost option that can swiftly be deployed for close air defence protection of crucial assets in rugged high-altitude areas as well as in the maritime domain.

title: Probe reveals 3rd 'donkey flight' from Dubai
description: Investigations by CID (crime and Railways) into illegal emigrations to the US using chartered flights have revealed that another plane had taken off for Nicaragua from Dubai on December 6 as well, taking the number of such known trips so far to three. On December 21, French officials did not allow a plane with 303 passengers - 96 of them from Gujarat - to take off from Vatry airport following a tip-off on suspected human smuggling. The plane had halted at the airport in France for refuelling. Two days before this incident, a charter had halted in Germany.

title: S Jaishankar, Ukraine foreign minister discuss peace formula
description: Ukraine foreign minister Dmytro Kuleba said Wednesday he spoke to his Indian counterpart S Jaishankar and informed him of Russia's recent "escalation of terror and mass air attacks'', which caused civilian suffering and destruction. Jaishankar said he had a useful conversation with Kuleba in which they exchanged views on the ongoing conflict in Ukraine. In what was his first call of the year, Kuleba said, the two discussed further cooperation on Ukraine's Peace Formula.

title: 103 killed in blasts at Iran on 4th anniv of Gen's assassination
description: A pair of explosions Wednesday at a commemoration for Iran’s former top military general Qassem Soleimani killed at least 103 people and wounded another 171, according to Iranian officials. The blasts sowed fear and grief in Iran and heightened tensions in the broader region even further a day after an explosion killed several Hamas officials in a suburb of Beirut. Iranian officials told state media that a pair of bombs placed in bags along the road toward the cemetery in Kerman, Iran, had exploded as a procession of people was on its way there to commemorate the four-year anniversary of Soleimani’s assassination by the United States.

title: 16 lakh bot attacks a minute hit G20 portal as Summit began
description: According to I4C CEO Rajesh Kumar, the 16 lakh bot attacks were part of an attempted distributed-denial-of-service (DDoS) attack. The aim of a DDoS attack is to overwhelm a network by flooding it with superfluous traffic so it can't handle requests from legitimate users. "When you do a DDoS attack, the attacker creates bots and they act on the attackers' behalf. They send multiple requests that the system can't handle," he said, adding they were treating one DDoS attack involving 16 lakh bots as "one security incident".

title: SC issues notice to LS secretary gen, but won't stay Mahua expulsion
description: The Supreme Court Wednesday agreed to examine Trinamool Congress leader Mahua Moitra's plea challenging her expulsion from Lok Sabha on grounds of "unethical conduct" and sought the Lok Sabha secretariat's response. But, it refused to stay the expulsion to allow her to participate in LS proceedings during pendency of the case, reports Amit Anand Choudhary. Appearing for her, senior advocate A M Singhvi said the principle of natural justice was violated in the hearing before the LS ethics committee and also in the proceedings of the lower House which decided to expel her.

title: SC: No need to further probe Hindenburg-Adani charges
description: The year-long controversy over Adani group stocks, triggered by short-seller Hindenburg Research’s allegation of stock manipulations, ended with a whimper on Wednesday as the Supreme Court rejected pleas for an SIT or CBI probe, approved market regulator Sebi’s investigation and ordered central agencies to probe Hindenburg’s role in causing loss to Indian investors. A bench of Chief Justice D Y Chandrachud and Justices J B Pardiwala and Manoj Misra, in a 46-page judgment, disposed of all the PILs on finding that there was no merit in the allegations relating to regulatory failure of Sebi

title: PM Modi writes to Ujjwala beneficiary in Ayodhya, gifts tea-set
description: The Prime Minister made a surprise visit last Saturday to the Ayodhya home of Meera Manjhi, the tenth-crore beneficiary of the PM Ujjwala Yojana, and had tea at her residence. "I was delighted to see your interviews after paying visit to your home. You and your family members were full of confidence while sharing your experience about my visit to your place. The smiles on faces of people like you is the most cherished capital I have. People like you give me strength to work harder," PM Modi wrote in a letter sent to Manjhi family.

title: BTech grad drowns in bid to save pet, dog swims to safety
India saw 129 cybercrimes per lakh population in 2023
description: Cybercrime rate in India (reported cybercrime complaints in NCRP per lakh population) in 2023 was 129, though statewise data shows Delhi leading with a rate of 755, followed by Haryana (381), and Telangana (261). Customer care, refund-based and KYC expiry frauds constituted 35% of the local-origin frauds, sextortion (mostly originating in Mewat region) 24%, online booking frauds 22%, AePS frauds and biometric cloning 11%, and Android malware 8%, Indian Cyber Coordination Centre (I4C) CEO Rajesh Kumar said.

title: India not withdrawing forces will imperil democracy, defence ties to continue: Maldives prez
Days after tea stop, PM Modi writes to 10th crore Ujjwala beneficiary
description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi wrote a letter to Ujjwala scheme beneficiary Meera Manjhi, extending New Year wishes. He expressed delight in meeting and interacting with her family in Ayodhya and having tea at her house. Modi also sent gifts to Manjhi, the 10th crore Ujjwala Yojana beneficiary. He mentioned seeing Manjhi's interview on TV channels and praised the family's ease and confidence. Modi emphasized that Manjhi's status as the 10 croreth beneficiary is proof that Indian dreams are being fulfilled.

title: 2nd Test: SA trail India after record-breaking Day 1
description: South Africa closed an extraordinary see-saw first day of the second and final Test against India at Newlands on 62 for three in their second innings, trailing the tourists by 36 runs after 23 wickets and several records fell on Wednesday. Aiden Markram (36 not out) and David Bedingham (7 not out) will hope to bat on and set India a challenging target on the second day.

title: 'Raj tilak hote hote ...': Chouhan's quip on losing out on CM race
Watch: Shastri's epic 'dump' remark after India's collapse
description: India collapsed to 153 all out in their first innings in the final session after skittling out South Africa for 55 on Day 1. It was the first time in history that a team lost 6 wickets without adding a run and as always former Indian cricketer-turned commentator Ravi Shastri stole the limelight with his on-air gem. Kohli emerged as the top-scorer for India with 46 runs, while captain Rohit Sharma and Shubman Gill contributed 39 and 36 runs, respectively.

title: Ira Khan is now officially married to Nupur Shikhare, see pics
description: Aamir Khan's daughter Ira Khan has married her partner Nupur Shikhare. They shared official wedding photos. The couple had pre-wedding ceremonies and a registered marriage. They will have a reception and ceremonial wedding rituals in Udaipur. The wedding embraced Maharashtrian traditions. The guest list included Aamir Khan, Kiran Rao, and other Bollywood celebrities.

title: SC's message: Trust Sebi over 3rd-party reports in Adani row
description: The Supreme Court of India reinforces the ongoing investigation into the Adani-Hindenburg controversy by the Securities and Exchange Board of India (Sebi). The court dismisses the need for further probes and emphasizes the adequacy of Sebi's efforts in addressing allegations of accounting fraud and stock manipulation. The ruling is a setback for the petitioners who challenged the adequacy and impartiality of the Sebi probe. The court's decision highlights Sebi's role in safeguarding market integrity and investor interests, rejecting additional investigations by the Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) or a special investigation team.

title: Watch: Chinese rocket booster explodes near residential area
description: Chinese rocket debris from Bejing's recent satellite launch fell near a residential area in Southern China. The China National Space Administration successfully launched two satellites into orbit from the Xichang Satellite Launch Center using the Long March 3B rocket. These satellites are part of China's Beidou Navigation Satellite System. The boosters of the Long March 3B rocket landed in the Guangxi region of South China. China has faced criticism for allowing rocket debris to accumulate and pose risks to residential areas.

title: No problem in paying for Russian oil, it’s all about price: Govt
SoftBank veteran is a billionaire after huge payday
‘Worm in sandwich:’ FSSAI notice to IndiGo over ‘unsafe food'
Google's former highest-paid exec is now billionaire Silicon Valley CEO
description: Nikesh Arora, the highest-paid executive at Google, became a billionaire after joining Palo Alto Networks. His net worth is now $1.5 billion. As the CEO of Palo Alto Networks, a cybersecurity software company, Arora received $125 million in stocks. The company's share price surged, making Arora's stake worth $830 million. He sold $300 million worth of shares in 2023. Arora's 2023 compensation includes up to 750,000 stocks, worth over $220 million. The company justified the award based on his strong performance and vested ownership.

title: Ex-model, accused of gangster's murder, killed in Gurugram
description: Former model Divya Pahuja, accused in a gangster's murder, was shot dead in a Gurugram hotel months after being granted bail. Three of the five accused were arrested while trying to dispose of her body. Pahuja was at the hotel to celebrate New Year with its owner, reportedly. The murder was linked to a conspiracy orchestrated by Binder Gujjar, who operated a rival gang and collaborated with Haryana Police officials. Pahuja was roped in as a honey trap, according to Mumbai Police

title: Wipro, ex-Wipro CFO Dalal referred to arbitration
Virat Kohli back in top 10 of ICC Test Rankings
description: Star Indian batter Virat Kohli, who had slipped out of the top 10 earlier in 2022, showcased his prowess with scores of 38 and 76 in the opening Test against South Africa last week, reclaiming his position among the top-ranked Test batsmen, according to ICC. Despite Kohli's rise in the ICC Test Rankings, he still remains 103 rating points behind the top-ranked batsman, Kane Williamson. Joe Root holds the second position, and Steve Smith is in the third spot.

title: TEC brings 37 more products under quick clearance scheme
description: The Telecommunication Engineering Centre (TEC) has expanded the Simplified Certification scheme (SCS) by adding 37 new products, including media gateway, IP security equipment, IP terminals, optical fibre or cable, and transmission terminal equipment. This move aims to reduce certification time from 8 weeks to 2 weeks and promote ease of doing business.

title: In a 1st, Isro taps Musk's SpaceX to put GSAT-N2 in orbit
20 killed in blasts near grave of slain Iran general
description: At least 20 people have been killed in explosions near assassinated commander Qassem Soleimani's cemetery in the southern city of Iran's Kerman, reported Iranian state media. The explosion occurred during the ceremony held to mark the killing of Iran's top commander in a US drone attack at Baghdad airport in 2020. The diplomatic relationship between Washington and Tehran had touched a new low after Solemani's killing. The United States assassinated Solemani in 2020 on former president Donald Trump's orders.

title: 'They keep hurting our faith': PM Modi attacks INDIA bloc
Watch: Warner gets 'Guard of Honour' from Pak players
description: David Warner, the left-handed batsman, has amassed a remarkable total of 8,695 runs in 111 Test matches at an average of 44.58. This impressive record comprises 26 centuries. Notably, his highest individual score of an unbeaten 335 runs was achieved against Pakistan in 2019. Warner's consistent and prolific performances have solidified his position as a key contributor to Australian cricket over the course of his Test career. In the current Test series against Pakistan, Warner has demonstrated his batting prowess by accumulating 208 runs in the two matches, maintaining an impressive average of 52.

title: Starlink launches 6 satellites that will connect to mobile phones
description: SpaceX launches satellites for satellite-based internet, enabling mobile phone connectivity anywhere on Earth. The technology, called Starlink, works with existing LTE phones and requires no hardware changes. Starlink aims to partner with mobile network operators (MNOs) to integrate their services into existing cellular networks. However, concerns exist about congestion and interference with existing satellite communication systems. In addition to mobile connectivity, Starlink's satellites will also improve broadband services for homes, businesses, and industries.

title: PM Modi-named Cheetah 'Aasha' delivers three cubs in Kuno
Cong, Left neglected women's quota demands: PM
How Siraj ripped apart SA's batting line-up in second Test
description: In a straight spell of nine overs, pacer Mohammed Siraj picked a career-best 6 for 15 as the South African batters made a beeline back to the dug-out, unable to counter the disconcerting bounce and the movement, both inward and outward, that he extracted off the surface.  India bundled out South Africa for 55, their lowest total against the visitors, inside lunch on day one of the second Test. It was also South Africa's lowest total in Test cricket since their readmission into international cricket in 1991.

title: Cong leader warns of ‘Godhra-like incident' in K'taka; BJP reacts
How there may be scope of mobile tariff hike in India
description: India's telecom tariffs are among the lowest in the world, with the percentage of telecom tariffs as a percentage of per capita gross national income (GNIpc) being second lowest after Brazil. India's telecom services tariff is the lowest globally at $2 per month, while Brazil's is significantly higher at $6.1 per month. Other countries like China, Philippines, Malaysia, US, Thailand, Mexico, and South Africa have much higher telecom tariffs.

title: iPhone 16 & other reasons Barclays gave for downgrading Apple
description: Barclays downgraded Apple stock, causing a 3.6% drop to a seven-week low. The company now has its most bearish recommendations in two years. Barclays analysts expect weakness in iPhone volumes and mix, as well as little growth in Macs, iPads, and wearables. Apple's demand slowdown and performance in China are concerns. Barclays slightly lowered its price target for Apple stock. The note highlights continued iPhone weakness, stagnant growth in Mac and iPad segments, deceleration in Services, and diminishing returns on the Apple ecosystem.

title: India explains reason behind Russian oil import drop
This company laid off its entire staff on a 'two-minute' call
description: Frontdesk, a proptech startup operating over 1,000 furnished apartments, laid off its entire workforce of 200 people due to failed attempts at raising additional capital. The CEO, Jesse DePinto, announced the layoffs during a two-minute Google Meet call. The company, founded in 2017, managed apartments across the US and had raised $26 million from investors. Despite recent challenges, including difficulties in securing investors and high upfront costs, Frontdesk had previously posted job openings and expressed optimism about future fundraising. DePinto also mentioned that the company would be filing for a state receivership as an alternative to bankruptcy.

title: Aircraft leasing in India picks up: Modair inducts fifth plane
description: ModAir Aviation inducts fifth aircraft, a two-seater training plane Tecnam P-Mentor, for an upcoming flying school in Karnataka. They plan to induct their sixth aircraft by the end of this fiscal year, which will be leased to non-scheduled Indian airline operators. ModAir Aviation supports PM Modi's vision and focuses on flight training and leasing of aircraft. The Indian government aims to develop a robust aircraft leasing industry in the country, as the Indian aviation market is growing rapidly. ModAir Aviation is committed to supporting this vision through the IFSC infrastructure in GIFT City.

title: Not just TTP: Pak grapples with another deadly terror group
'One waits for coronation but ...': Chouhan turns emotional
description: Former chief minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan turned emotional while addressing his supporters on Tuesday, saying that sometimes one waits for "rajtilak" (coronation) but ends up in "vanvas" (exile).Chouhan, who was addressing a gathering in Shahganj town under his Budhni assembly seat on January 2, promised that he will continue to be among the people, especially his sisters.The four-time chief minister, who was instrumental in BJP's landslide victory in the recent Madhya Pradesh elections, had to make way for Mohan Yadav last month after the party decided to go for a new line of leadership in the state.

title: Pornhub is no longer available in these 2 US states, here’s why
description: The new age verification laws have gone into effect in Montana and North Carolina, resulting in some adult websites blocking access or requesting government ID for verification. Pornhub and other Aylo websites are now inaccessible in these regions, with a video message from performer Cherie DeVille explaining the risks of sharing personal identification. DeVille advocates for device-based identification as a safer solution. Searches for VPN have surged in Montana and North Carolina. Other adult websites use third-party providers like Yoti for age verification instead of blocking access.

title: Lakshadweep: PM lays foundation of projects worth Rs 1,156 cr
description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi inaugurated and laid the foundation for various projects worth Rs 1,150 crore in the Union Territory of Lakshadweep on Wednesday. The projects were launched at a function attended by hundreds of islanders. This includes the Kochi-Lakshadweep Islands Submarine Optical Fibre Connection (KLI - SOFC) project, which he announced in his Independence Day speech in August 2020 at the Red Fort. The transformational initiative aims to overcome the challenge of slow internet speed on Lakshadweep Island.

title: SC to hear Mahua's plea in week commencing March 11
description: Supreme Court asks Secretary General of Lok Sabha to respond to Mahua Moitra's plea challenging her expulsion from Lok Sabha in cash-for-query case. Court declines to issue interim order on Moitra's request to attend House proceedings. Lok Sabha Speaker and Lok Sabha Committee on Ethics not issued notices, only Lok Sabha secretary general to reply. Further hearings scheduled for March 11. Moitra found guilty of sharing Lok Sabha members' portal credentials, motion for expulsion adopted by voice vote.

title: No issues if WFI comes back without Sanjay Singh: Sakshi
description: Veteran wrestler Sakshi Malik has expressed reservations about the newly-elected Wrestling Federation of India, urging the exclusion of Sanjay Singh from the body. Malik announced her retirement in December due to Singh's election as WFI president. In an interaction with the media, Malik stated that she has no issues with the new federation except for Singh's involvement and that she would accept the WFI without him. She also ruled out her personal involvement in the administration of the federation.

title: Hilarious Zomato delivery on horse amid fuel shortage
description: A Zomato delivery agent in Hyderabad delivers food on a horse due to fuel shortages caused by truck protests. The agent replaces his two-wheeler with a horse saddle and carries a Zomato delivery bag. He explains that he couldn't get petrol for his vehicle and decided to go old-school. The incident brings smiles to netizens and highlights the need for eco-friendly deliveries in the logistics industry.

title: Junior wrestlers protest against Punia, Malik, Phogat at Jantar Mantar
description: Hundreds of junior wrestlers from Uttar Pradesh, Haryana, and Delhi protested against the loss of a crucial year in their wrestling careers at the Jantar Mantar in New Delhi. They attributed the setback to top wrestlers Bajrang Punia, Sakshi Malik, and Vinesh Phogat. Protesters from various wrestling academies, including Arya Samaj Akhara and Virender Wrestling Academy, raised slogans against Bajrang Punia, Sakshi Malik, and Vinesh Phogat, with banners promoting their dissatisfaction with the top athletes.

title: Srikkanth urges Gill to prove himself across conditions
description: Former Indian captain Kris Srikkanth has emphasized the importance of young opening batsman Shubman Gill's consistent performance in diverse cricketing conditions globally to meet international cricket expectations. Srikkanth compared Gill with India run machine Virat Kohli to be a successful cricketer, stating that Gill must score runs overseas and not just in the sub-continent. This is crucial for Gill's success in international cricket, as he is expected to fulfill expectations in the longer format too.

title: TRAI to Airtel, Jio and more: Warn customers about such SMS
description: Trai has asked telecom operators in India to warn subscribers about fake messages being sent in its name. The messages seek a no objection certificate for tower installation or verification of existing mobile numbers. Telecom operators will share an advisory message from Trai, cautioning subscribers about fraudulent messages and calls. The message should be considered potentially fraudulent and can be reported to the national cybercrime reporting portal. Telecom operators will send the cautionary message to every subscriber, starting from January 1, and will schedule texts in regional languages.

title: 'The bloke is a freak...': Nasser lauds Surya's T20 brilliance
description: Former England captain Nasser Hussain has praised Indian batsman Suryakumar Yadav as a "freak" in T20 cricket and anticipates his standout performance at the upcoming T20 World Cup. Hussain praised Yadav's remarkable command and entertaining style in the shortest format, highlighting his potential as a key player in the Caribbean and USA tournament. Hussain highlighted Yadav's proficiency and impact in T20s, where he currently holds the No.1 spot in the ICC Rankings for T20I batters since 2022.

title: SC asks Sebi to complete Adani case probe in 3 months
description: The Supreme Court decided against ordering a SIT or CBI probe into the Gautam Adani-Hindenburg Research controversy. Instead, the court directed Sebi to complete its investigation into alleged violations by Adani group companies. The court expressed skepticism about the authenticity of the OCCRP and Hindenburg reports on stock manipulations by Adani group. It upheld the validity of FPI regulations and rejected conflict of interest allegations against the SIT members. The court emphasized limited intervention in Sebi's regulatory framework and advised examining legal infractions by Hindenburg report.

title: 5 health resolutions to manage your diabetes in 2024
description: Empower your journey with diabetes management in the new year by exploring achievable health resolutions. This article guides you through personalized strategies, including lifestyle modifications, dietary choices, and exercise routines, tailored to enhance overall well-being. Embrace practical goals to navigate the complexities of diabetes, fostering a healthier and more balanced lifestyle in 2024.

title: SC asks Sebi to complete Adani case probe in 3 months
description: In a significant development, the Supreme Court has declined a request for an SIT or CBI inquiry into the Adani-Hindenburg controversy. This controversy had previously led to a dramatic meltdown in the share prices of Adani group companies. The apex court said that there was no substantial basis to question the fairness of the ongoing probe by the Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI), which has already completed investigations in 22 out of 24 cases.

title: Rajinikanth to grace Ram Mandir inauguration ceremony in Ayodhya
description: Rajinikanth has been invited to Ayodhya Ram Mandir Inauguration, which is scheduled to happen on January 22, and here's what the busy actor said about attending the historical event.

title: Watch: Why Marsh checked with umpire for 'no ball'
description: Experiencing the excruciating moment of taking a wicket, only to have the umpire signal it as a no-ball, is a nightmare for any bowler. Mitchell Marsh found himself in this unfortunate situation during the opening day of the third Test against Pakistan at the SCG on Wednesday.

title: Croma has warned gadget and electronic buyers about these websites
description: Croma warns customers about fraudsters impersonating employees; valid payment methods are on official website, in-store or Tata Neu App; Croma doesn't call to sell deals or gift cards; offers communicated through website, Croma WhatsApp channel, and valid email IDs; report suspicious activity to 18005727662 or customersupport@croma.

title: Massive fire at factory in Delhi's Bawana, none hurt
10-yr-old girl detected with 'Chinese pneumonia'
Deadly strikes hit Ukraine, Russia border
description: Deadly strikes hit residential buildings in Ukraine and a Russian border region Tuesday as an escalation of aerial attacks also wounded dozens and prompted Kyiv to urge speedier Western weapons shipments. Meanwhile, a new Ukrainian strike on Russia's Belgorod border region killed at least one person Tuesday and wounded five, the local governor said.

title: Akram, Younis criticize decision to rest Afridi for Sydney Test
description: Former Pakistan pace greats Wasim Akram and Waqar Younis have criticised the decision to rest fast bowler Shaheen Shah Afridi in the third and final Test against Australia. The controversial move came after Pakistan had already lost the series 0-2, raising questions about the absence of Shaheen in David Warner's farewell Test. Akram claimed the call was entirely Shaheen's and not influenced by team management. He urged players to prioritize between aspiring to become greats or focusing solely on financial gains through T20 cricket.

title: TN: Driverless metro trains to cut through 12-storey building
description: Chennai Metro Rail Limited (CMRL) is planning a transitoriented development plan for its phase-2 project, which includes developing properties around metro stations in three locations. These locations are Thirumangalam, Koyambedu, and Thirumayilai. In Thirumangalam, a 12-storey building will be constructed where metro trains will pass through and halt at the third floor station. CMRL will acquire a plot near Thirumangalam flyover for this purpose. The cost of building these stations is included in the phase-2 project, and CMRL will request funds from the state government for property development.

title: How 'written in blood' rules saved lives in Tokyo plane crash
description: In a harrowing yet miraculous incident on Tuesday, passengers aboard Japan Airlines (JAL) flight 516 narrowly escaped a catastrophic event at Haneda Airport, Tokyo. The flight ended in a dramatic runway collision and an ensuing inferno. Genki Miyamoto, the 39-year-old captain of the Coast Guard plane, miraculously survived, though his crewmates, aged between 27 and 56, were not as fortunate. Miyamoto's survival and subsequent alert to his base about the explosion added a glimmer of hope amidst the tragedy.

title: Kejriwal to skip third ED summons in excise policy case
Joshimath's agony lingers, families out in cold
Assam: 12 killed as truck collides with bus in Golaghat
'Gujarat passengers agreed to pay Rs 60-80 lakh to enter US'
description: Over 60 people from Gujarat, India, were on a Nicaragua-bound plane that was sent back from France due to suspected human trafficking. These passengers had agreed to pay immigration agents between Rs 60 lakh to Rs 80 lakh to help them cross into the US illegally after reaching Nicaragua. Most of the passengers were from Mehsana, Ahmedabad, Gandhinagar, and Anand districts. The passengers revealed that the agents had promised to take them to the US border from Nicaragua and had even provided them with air tickets and emergency funds.

title: Chhattisgarh: Minor raped repeatedly, beaten, thrown into pond
description: In Chhattisgarh's Gaurela-Pendra-Marwahi district, a 16-year-old girl was abducted, raped, tortured, and beaten by a 26-year-old man who then threw her into a pond, thinking she was dead. Miraculously, she survived and was found unconscious by villagers the next morning. The accused has been arrested, but his mother, who allegedly abetted him in the crime, is still on the run. The survivor is currently hospitalized, battling severe injuries. The incident occurred on December 28 when the minor was offered a lift and then taken to a forest where she was raped.

title: ED raids premises of Soren's aide in illegal mining case
Hyderabad, B'luru airports 2nd, 3rd in punctuality: Report
description: Hyderabad and Bengaluru airports ranked second and third in on-time performance globally in 2023. Minneapolis' St Paul International Airport topped the list with an OTP of 84.44%. Japanese airports declined in OTP. Kolkata's Netaji Subhash Chandra airport ranked ninth in the 'medium airports' category. IndiGo secured the eighth rank in the low-cost carriers category.

title: Odisha CM to steal Ayodhya thunder with Puri project launch
description: BJP gains political dividend from the inauguration of the Ram Temple in Ayodhya. In response, Odisha Chief Minister Naveen Patnaik plans an equally grand inauguration of the Jagannath Heritage Corridor Project in Puri. This strategic move aims to counter Narendra Modi's Ayodhya narrative. Naveen meticulously plans a series of month-long activities to create awareness and reach out to all households in Odisha. The project includes improvements to the Jagannath Temple and other shrines in Odisha.

title: CR chief PRO transferred over RTI on PM selfie booths cost
description: Central Railway transfers its chief public relations officer Shivraj Manaspure before the end of his tenure after he provided information on the cost of Prime Minister Narendra Modi's 3D selfie booths in response to an RTI query. The Railway Board issued an advisory on handling RTI applications, citing concerns about the quality of responses from zonal railways. The cost of the temporary and permanent selfie booths at various stations was revealed in the information obtained from Central Railway. Manaspure's transfer is not officially linked to the RTI reply, but railway sources suggest that he was recognized for his efforts in increasing earnings and addressing ticketless travel and thefts during his previous role at Bhusawal division.

title: IIT-Guwahati girl dies after partying on New Year's eve
Mamata has first & last word, Abhishek her general
description: TMC spokesperson clarifies senior-junior debate; Mamata Banerjee has final say; Abhishek Banerjee is her general. Veterans, Bakshi, Bandyopadhyay, and Goswami will fight elections with unity. CM, Abhishek, Hakim, Bakshi, and Bandyopadhyay will seek votes as a united front. Veterans have specific roles, and their experience is invaluable. TMC is a big family. Party disputes are transparent and resolved internally. Mamata Banerjee is the last word in TMC.

title: 16 cases of JN.1 variant in Delhi; mild symptoms reported
description: COVID-19 cases are increasing in the country, with 312 cases of the rapidly spreading JN.1 variant detected on the second day of the new year. Delhi has reported 16 cases of the JN.1 variant. Kerala has reported 147 cases, followed by Goa with 51 cases, Gujarat with 34 cases, Maharashtra with 26 cases, Tamil Nadu with 22 cases, Karnataka with 8 cases, Rajasthan with 5 cases, Telangana with 2 cases, and Odisha with one case. The World Health Organisation (WHO) classified JN.1 as a "variant of interest" due to its rapid spread.

title: Techie jumps to death from 21st floor of building
Dengue patient raped thrice in ICU: Sweeper gets 7 yrs in jail
description: A sweeper of Apollo Hospital in Gandhinagar district court has been sentenced to seven-year imprisonment for raping a 19-year-old dengue patient. The court also fined the convict Rs 2,000 and ordered a compensation of Rs 20,000 to the victim. A Pakistani doctor, who was also charged with rape, absconded after being released on bail. The incident had raised concerns about the illegal employment of doctors of Pakistani origin in private hospitals.

title: 2nd Test: India look to pick up the pieces vs SA
description: Rohit Sharma, the leader, will need to channelise the champion tactician that resides in him as India look to restore parity against South Africa and remain consequential in the World Championship points table when the second Test starts in Cape Town on Wednesday. The last six weeks of 2023 haven't exactly been kind to Rohit, who is still trying to pick up the pieces after India's World Cup final defeat. There would be no better way to start 2024 than a win at the Newlands ground.

title: Daughter steps out to meet her lover at 4am, dad kills both
description: A man hacked his daughter and her boyfriend to death with a spade after catching them outside the house at 4am. He later turned himself in to the police in Budaun district, UP. The victims, a 19-year-old woman and her 20-year-old boyfriend, were killed in Paroli. The woman's father, Mahesh, confessed to the crime, stating that he suspected his daughter of planning to elope with their neighbor's son. The bodies were sent for autopsy and the woman's parents have been arrested.

title: Prior & post facto green nods can't co-exist, SC told
As teen gets a stent, docs point to trend of premature heart attacks
Will Kejriwal appear before ED? AAP weighs legal options
Will Kejriwal appear before ED? AAP weighs legal options
Dawood's childhood home to be auctioned in Mumbai on Jan 5
description: The auction, which will take place in Mumbai, will be carried out by the competent authority and administrator of the Smugglers and Foreign Exchange Manipulators (Forfeiture of Property) Act or Safema, which is under the Union ministry of finance. The four properties to be auctioned now have a total reserve price of Rs 19.2 lakh. All the four properties are agricultural and are located in Khed's Mumbake village, where Dawood and his siblings spent some part of their childhood.

title: CXO prenups: IT companies make jumping ship tougher
Binny Bansal back with e-tail startup
No minimum balance charges on 'inoperative accounts': RBI
'Salaar' starring Prabhas box office collection, Day 12 and more
description: Despite recording its lowest collections, 'Salaar: Cease Fire - Part 1' maintained its lead at the box office on its 12th day. The film earned around Rs 7.50 crore on this day, boosting its total net collection to Rs 369.37 crores. The Hindi dubbed version played a significant role in this success, contributing to the film's earnings across all languages. In addition, the film witnessed notable occupancy rates in Hindi theatres, with 10.80% in the morning shows and 19.79% in the night shows.
